feature1.explanation: Both texts exhibit a formal punctuation style with correct usage of commas and periods.

feature2.explanation: Text 1 shows a more formal and structured lexical and grammatical choice compared to Text 2 which appears more casual and conversational.

feature3.explanation: Text 1 has more structured and concise sentences, while Text 2 contains longer, more informal sentences.

feature4.explanation: Text 1 is more informative and directive, while Text 2 is personal and narrative in nature.

feature5.explanation: Both texts are free from spelling and typographical errors.

overall.explanation: Considering the differences in lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure, and discourse style, the texts are less likely to be written by the same author despite some similarities in punctuation and error-free writing.
